title.narrative: Integrated Emergency Community Management of Acute Malnutrition (CMAM), Hygiene and Sanitation in East Hararghe Zone, Oromia Region

description.narrative: (1) Implementing Targeted Supplementary Feeding (TSF) in all four target Woredas to reach moderately and acutely malnourished children and PLW. International Medical Corps will use bi-weekly base premix distribution approach to manage the intended beneficiaries and the implementation will be in collaboration with woreda DPPFSC is Disaster Prevention and Preparedness and Food Security Commission (DPPFSC) and Health offices and food distribution agents (FDAs) at distribution sites; (2) Supporting and strengthening management of Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) and referral linkage between stabilization center (SC) and outpatient therapeutic program (OTP); (3) Building the capacity of government MoH staff at each level (Hospital, Health Center and Health Post) through basic, refresher, on-the-job-training on the CMAM approach, identification of measles cases and supportive supervision; (4) Building the capacity of health facilities on SAM management through provision of medicines, medical supplies and logistical support; (5) Reinforcing of linkages between stakeholders, including the Woreda and zonal Ministry of Health (MoH) and UNICEF, with special emphasis on the provision of ready-to-use-therapeutic foods (RUTF); (6) Providing logistical support for RUTF and TSFP food transportation from zone to woredas and from woredas to health facilities; (7) Improving monitoring and supportive supervision for the CMAM program; (8) Expanding geographic coverage of CMAM in the targeted area by opening new OTP and SC sites. In consultation with the Woreda Health office International Medical Corps will support 45 existing OTP and 3 SCs sites and will establish 14 new OTPs and 3 SCs in collaboration with zonal and woreda health offices to increase CMAM coverage in the target woredas; (9) Strengthening community mobilization, active case finding, absent and defaulter tracing and referral using local Community Volunteer Health Promoters; (10) Sensitizing community-based associations, including People Living with HIV/AIDS (PLWA) and women’s associations on available basic services including nutrition; and (11) Strengthening community awareness activities through training of community volunteers and health extension workers (HEWs) and providing information, education and communication (IEC) materials.

The overall goal of the project is to reduce morbidity and mortality related to acute malnutrition, and poor hygiene and sanitation among children under-five and Pregnant and Lactating Women (PLW) in Babile, Golo Oda, Kumbi and Meyu Muluke Woredas in East Hararghe Zone, Oromia Region. This goal will be accomplished through Community Management of Acute Malnutrition (CMAM) and Sanitation and Hygiene interventions.
